question: 逸れる
userAnswer:
<tag><ja>はぐれる</ja>:</tag> to: loose-sight-of/get-separated-from/stray-from
<tag><ja>それる</ja>:</tag> stray/{turn/veer}-away/swerve | digress/deviate
activeAnswer:
<tag><ja>はぐれる</ja>:</tag> to: loose-sight-of/get-separated-from/stray-from
<tag><ja>それる</ja>:</tag> stray/{turn/veer}-away/swerve | digress/deviate
sourceMnemonic: You already learned that <ja>逸らす</ja> means "to turn away," so this means that but also <vocabulary>to stray</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading.  You've already learned this mnemonic but here's a quick review: 

If you're the type of person who starts <vocabulary>to stray</vocabulary> easily, you'll end up saying <reading>sorry</reading> (<ja>それ</ja>) a lot. Even if you don't do it often, if you stray, say sorry!
